See also: <nowiki>[[NokiaEvolutionSyncing-Gnokii]]</nowiki>

The <nowiki>[[http://www.gnokii.org/|gnokii]]</nowiki> project began in 1998 to connect Nokia mobile phones to Linux.

With a little manual configuration, it is possible to backup contacts, send SMS and edit your calendar.

This example is for a Nokia 6300 over bluetooth. Configuration specifics for your phone can be found at the <nowiki>[[http://wiki.gnokii.org/index.php/Config|gnokii website.]]</nowiki>

# Pair your phone to the computer using the Gnome Bluetooth Applet on your top panel or using the BluetoothSetup instructions.
# Find the Bluetooth ID of the connected handset using <code>hcitool scan</code>
# <code>cp /etc/gnokiirc ~/.gnokiirc</code>
# <code>nano ~/.gnokiirc</code>
# Change the Bluetooth port to <code>port = aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff</code> where the letters correspond to the hcitool scan.
# Set the model to <code>model = 6510</code>
# Test the connection using <code>gnokii --identify</code>.

Find Xgnokii in your Applications/Accessories top panel menu and use your phone from your computer.
